author: Anonymous Mouse
title: Error running submission queue
question:
Handed in problem set 1, the following result came back... tried to use the link for autograder messages and policies. https://cs110.students.cs.ubc.ca/psets/autograder.shtml
The link shows "object not found", and nothing else. 
AUTOGRADING GRADE:   0    (out of 100)

Error running submission queue/handin-16422935811642293581006.rkt:183:11: @template: image is not a legal type name, (listof <TypeName>), or one of "htdw-main, fn-composition, backtracking, try-catch, 2-one-of, encapsulated, use-abstract-fn, genrec, bin-tree, arb-tree, accumulator, or for-each"
  at: image
  in: image
Edit: Solved, after changing i to capital letter I in (@template Image) , it worked, thanks!
student_answer:
In my experience, if there is a single "error" in the code, the grade will be returned as 0. Meaning if you got everything correct except for one minor mistake (causing the program to not run properly), your grade will be 0. 
I would suggest try handing it in with the error deleted, then if you get a grade, you will know that the hand-in system is working for you. Then, you can try to correct the mistake in your program.
instructor_answer:
Glad you found the answer :)
Remember that the autograder report is written in plain English, so that you should be able to interpret the message on your own.
